title: Can I write my own will? - Quora

response.answer_text: Original question: Can I write my own will? Yes, you can. If your will is going to be complicated, then it might be worth having a professional do it, but the vast majority of people don’t have complicated wills. There are many templates available, just get one that fits the regulations in your country and fill it out. Just use plain language, there’s no need for any “legal-speak”, and you should read it over carefully to make sure that it makes your wishes clear.

That depends on the law of your country. But as a general rule, holographic wills are allowed. Note that in many jurisdictions, preterition of heirs is not allowed. Some legal systems adopt the legitime concept of succession. Those factors will have effects on the validity and/or distribution of properties in your will.
